Sudden and significant increase in netwo.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log and dpd.log for connection volume and bytes transferred per unit time, segmented by destination IP/port or network segment. Apply time series analysis or moving averages to detect sudden spikes that exceed historical baselines or statistically significant deviations (e.g., exceeding N standard deviations or IQR thresholds) in throughput.

Abnormal distribution of network traffic.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and dpd.log to calculate the distribution of traffic by protocol, source IP/port, and destination IP/port. Compare current distributions to historical baselines using metrics like entropy. Flag periods where the traffic mix significantly deviates from the norm, particularly focusing on unexpected high volumes of specific protocols (e.g., UDP, ICMP) or connections from a disproportionately large number of source IPs relative to destination IPs.
